quest.name: That Old Familiar Feeling
journal: First Sword Mylla wishes to assign you another task.
A band of Amalj'aa archers has been raiding caravans near Camp Drybone. Mylla has already dispatched several gladiators to assist with patrols, and bids you travel to eastern Thanalan to join them.
You luck upon and slay the Amalj'aa archers, rescuing a wounded guildmate and a cowering merchant. Speak with the gladiator and see if he needs aid.
Your guildmate assures you that his wounds are not mortal, and that he can look after the merchant. Return to the Gladiators' Guild and report to Mylla.

Shortly after your return, the guild erupts into chaos when Aldis enters. The First Sword is especially upset, demanding that he leave or face dire consequences. Aldis agrees and makes to depart, but not before requesting that you join him at the Quicksand for a drink.

Your conversation with Aldis is interrupted when a gang of sellswords bursts into the Quicksand, intent on slaying the man. In an impressive display of swordsmanship, Aldis slays most of the assassins, though you do your part as well. His mood soured, Aldis wanders off in search of a quieter tavern. Return to the guild and speak with Mylla.

Finally recovered from the shock of Aldis's earlier intrusion, Mylla recalls that she wished to teach you something new. She hopes that your new Shield Lob technique, with which you can attack enemies at range, will serve you well in the future.

※The next gladiator quest will be available from Mylla upon reaching level 20.
objectives: Search for your guildmates near Camp Drybone.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Hail, Forename. You come at a good time. I've another task I wish to assign you.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The Immortal Flames and the Brass Blades have both requested the guild's assistance in maintaining security at Camp Drybone, a vital outpost along the Royal Allagan Sunway.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The Amalj'aa have been raiding caravans with reckless abandon, creating a significant disruption in trade.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Ul'dah has a long, troubled history with the Amalj'aa, so raids are not unheard of. However, this recent escalation must be addressed.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Go to Camp Drybone and search for these raiders, Forename. I've already dispatched other gladiators to patrol the region, so I suggest you speak with one for more information.

dialogue.name: GUILDMEMBER
dialogue.text: Get down! They're still here!

dialogue.name: GUILDMEMBER
dialogue.text: <cough> <wheeze> Don't worry, sisterbrother, I'll be fine─though maybe not when the First Sword is done with me, eh? Go and tell her that the Amalj'aa are dead─leave the merchant to me.

dialogue.name: GUILDMEMBER
dialogue.text: <cough> <wheeze> Tell the First Sword that the Amalj'aa are dead. I'll look after the merchant.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: I knew I was right to send you, Forename! You've done us proud.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Seven hells, this place reeks of sweat! How do you expect a man to concentrate on his swordplay like this!?

dialogue.name: GUILDMEMBER
dialogue.text: Aldis!?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: You remember me! How goes it, brother? Still waving your sword around like a feather duster?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: You...you...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Good to see you too, Mylla my dear. You're more beautiful than I remember.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Y-You're alive!? Where have you been all these years!? Answer me!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Me? Well, if you must know, I'm on a spiritual journey of self-discovery.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Dammit, Aldis, this is serious! We all thought you were dead! And for you to walk in here, as though nothing ever happened─have you forgotten how you dishonored us!? I should cut you down where you stand!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Ho ho, that's the Mylla I remember, all fire and brimstone! I knew that pretty face could still contort itself into some terrifying shapes!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Ahhh, don't pout, girl, I'm just having fun. But, as you wish, I'll go.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Forename, was it? Why don't you join me at the Quicksand? I could use some company, and I doubt anyone else here would be so kind.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: That...that bastard. Why now, after all these years...?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Ho, you came. Sorry you had to witness that little reunion between me and Mylla.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: The Sword of Nald, back from the dead─you'd think I'd be greeted by throngs of adoring fans, not threats of violence...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Listen, Forename. You're good with a sword, that's plain to see.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: But more than that, you've got purpose. There's a fire burning within you.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: As a former man of conviction, I can recognize a kindred spirit.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Gerolt named her Frenzy. She's one of a magnificent pair of swords that the drunken prodigy forged for Coliseum champions.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: The man who wielded her twin had eyes that burned like yours...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Forename, I─

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: The hells!?

dialogue.name: ARCHER
dialogue.text: Aldis, Sword of Nald! We've come for your head!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: If you do that, then how the hells am I supposed to enjoy my ale?

dialogue.name: ARCHER
dialogue.text: Arrogant fool! Prepare to meet your maker!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Well, ain't you a bunch of impatient, humorless fellas.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Up for a bit of fun, Forename? I'll lead, you follow.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Didn't think he'd go so far as to send a gang of sellswords into the Quicksand in broad daylight.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Why is it never a bevy of beauties?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Let's continue this another time, shall we? I need to find a new place to drink─one with more attractive company than this sorry lot.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: My apologies, Forename─I meant to teach you a new technique earlier, but when that idiot arrived, I completely forgot. He's just so...infuriating.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Ahem. The Shield Lob technique will allow you to attack from afar without the need for ranged weaponry.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Since we gladiators are primarily close-range fighters, the ability to draw the attention of distant enemies is a valuable asset. May it serve you well in the field, Forename!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next gladiator quest will be available from Mylla upon reaching level 20.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You feel a rush of air as an arrow whistles by your head!

dialogue.name: SCENE00040
dialogue.text: Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with “CLSGLA150”?

dialogue.name: SCENE00040
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: SCENE00040
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defend yourself from the unknown assailants!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text:
Watch closely now, Forename!
I'll show you how a Coliseum champion fights!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Is this all you've got!? Try to keep up, boys!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Those weaklings're all yours, Forename!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Aye, that's the sort of sport I crave!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Watch their eyes, Forename, not their hands!
